{"step_by_step_thinking": "Barbiturates are central nervous system depressants. They slow down brain function and can lead to respiratory depression. In acute poisoning, the person may not be able to breathe adequately, leading to respiratory failure. Renal and liver failure are not the immediate consequences of acute barbiturate poisoning. While convulsions can occur in barbiturate withdrawal, they are not typically seen in acute poisoning.", "answer_choice": "C"}
